andlanna wrote:
> Hi there, 
> 
> I'm having a strange problem with Heritrix. When I criate a simple
> job, consisting with one or more seeds from the same domain (eg:
> http://www.zzz.com.br/ and http://www.zzz.com.br/aaa), and create an
> exclude filter with the URIRegExpFilter, the URI's that are covered by
> the regular expression has not been crawled... It's perfect! 
> 
> But, when I create a job (or a profile), with an override for the
> domain of the seed (http://www.zzz.com.br, in my example), and use the
> same filter of the single job, it has not been applied. The URI's that
> I don't want, are beeing captured. 
> 
> Anybody has an idea of what is happening?

One idea of something to check: is the override set up as intended?

I believe stray space/dot characters can lead to confusion, as can
the way overrides are hierarchically organized in reverse-order of
hostname parts. That is, inside the (possibly empty) 'br' override,
is a (possibly empty) 'com.br' override, which has inside it a
(possibly empty) 'zzz.com.br' override, which has inside it the
'www.zzz.com.br' override.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
